settings.title: PORTABLE CHARGER
settings.text: This thing will hold 6000 mAh of charge that can get you out of a battery jam. It packs a light, one usb port and an incorporated led indicator to tell you how much charge it is holding.

settings.title: SILICONE BAKING CUPS
settings.text: Great for parties, our handy silicone baking pans fit appetizers of all types and make for easy cleanup when the party is finished. Dishwasher safe and reusable, these pans are crowd pleasers. Sold in packs of 10 and you can fit 7 of them in GoSun Sport tray at a time.

settings.title: EXTRA GRILL PANS
settings.text: Let the party continue with a set of stainless steel Cooking Pans for the GoSun Grill.These spares are perfect for heating up another dish after your first course, as well as storing leftovers.

settings.page_quote: USE COUPON CODE WINTER100 AT CHECKOUT TO RECEIVE $100 OFF of THE PURCHASE OF A GOSUN GRILL!

settings.title: CALLING all Executive Chefs, Restauratuers, and Food Trucks to an innovative solar-cooking challenge using Cincinnati's own award winning GoSun solar stoves. All proceeds will go to hurricane relief efforts.
settings.content:
Tuesday, September 26th, 2017 - 10AM to 2PM

LUNCH-TIME HURRICANE RELIEF FUNDRAISER FOOD CHALLENGE HIGHLIGHTS & DETAILS

$2,250 in prize money goes to aid hurricane relief efforts

12 GoSun stoves donated to hurricane relief organizations

Only 12 teams chosen to participate

3 discerning judges including local celebrity chef Jean-Robert and our own Patrick Sherwin

$150 suggested donation

2 GoSun stoves provided for competition use (one is given to participants to keep afterward!)

Must cook 1 entre and 1 dessertMaximum of 5 ingredients (unlimited seasoning + spices) per dish 

For more information about this event please contact Davey Jones | 859.803.1191

settings.title: Registration Rules | Q & A
settings.content:
Upon registration, the participant will be delivered a GoSun solar stove in order to practice and familiarize themselves with the product before the competition. 
Entry Price: $150 
Contestants will receive a Solar Stove and opportunity to win a shared pool of prizes totalling $2,250 made out to a CHARITY of your choice 
Date:
Tuesday September 26th, 2017 
Rain Date:
Tueday October 3rd, 2017 
Schedule: 
10:30 am Arrive/Start Prep; 11:00am Orientation; 11:30 am Start Cook; by 1:15pm submit for judging; 1:40 Prizes Awarded/Photos; 2pm Event end 
Location: 
Washington Park, Cincinnati opposite Music Hall in the paved designated area. Event is permitted through the City of Cincinnati and 3CDC 

Type of Event: 
This is not being promoted as a public event but more of a "TV Show" type cooking challenge due to the space available. However, we anticipate friends/family/supporters may attend though space including participants is limited to around 50. The public park area provides a good area for viewing and our MC will try to keep any passers-by/supporters engaged 
# of Chefs:  
One main chef per restaurant + helper 
Anticiated Participants: 
12 Chefs/Restaurants 
Ingredients/Pantry: 
Restaurants supply their own food (protein/produce etc) for their chosen recipe; handtowels and basic sanitation inc gloves will be available. 5 ingredients limit - any amount of spice/seasoning is permitted 
Dishes: 
ONE Main Dish + ONE Dessert; dishes can cook simultaneously utilizing the TWO solar stoves supplied 
Judging/Criteria: 
Creativity using Solar | Taste | Presentation. 3 Judges will adjudicate. We anticipate at least one will be a food critic, one will be GoSun Founder CEO Patrick Sherwin + one other. 
Equipment: Tables, table cloth (GoSun Sponsor branded) are provided. Please bring equipment you require for your recipes. Cutting Boards - by all means bring your own. GoSun will supply flat food safe cutting mats but you may want to bring a more substantial cutting board 
Solar Stoves Supplied: 
GoSun is supplying TWO solar stoves for use on the day; ONE for the main course + ONE for dessert. Contestants will be given a Solar Stove to keep as part of entry fee. 
About Solar Cooking: 
We recommend keeping recipes fairly simple and able to comfortably fit within the "tubular" tray form using ingredients suitably prepped. Don't be intimidated! We know you can cook anything, anywhere and to help further we have great resources within GoSun Facebook Community Kitchen Group who have posted recipes, videos etc demonstrating the VERSATILITY and EASE of use cooking solar with GoSun. Keep it simple, creative and don't overload the tray to esnure you complete your dishes against the clock! Bake/Steam/Roast . . . the cooking method is more akin to what you might typically cook in an oven or stove-top. The cooking environment is VERY MOIST and not like grilling. You can find out more by going  here to find out more from our Facebook community. 
Practice/Familiarization 
This is a fun cooking device. We strongly recommend carefully reading the easy instructions inside your Sport solar stove and practicing your recipe - it should take around an hour or less in full sun conditions 
About You: 
Be true to your own style and challenge yourself to boldly transform a signature dish using solar! 
Publicity: 
Local media outlets will be invited in addition to GoSun social media pre and post event PR. Entry by you and your restaurant gives permission to include you by name and photos/videos as willing participants. Copies or access to event PR will be made available to participants. A live event MC will circulate to briefly interact with chefs and communicate real-time observations and interviews with chefs. "This is a fun cooking device." We strongly recommend carefully reading the easy instructions insert.  
About the "Sport" Solar Stove 
GoSun's solar stove simply uses UV rays from the sun, traps the heat inside the glass tube ("like Pyrex") and cooks food held in the cooking tray reaching temperatures up to 550 degrees Fahrenheit in optimum conditions. Cooking through clouds is possible. A hot day is not necessary - a sunny day is perfect.

settings.title: GET THE FULL PACKAGE
settings.content: MEET THE SPORT PROPACK

settings.faq-cnt:
What can the GoSun Sport cook?

Bake, roast, steam and fry, the GoSun Sport is a versatile solar oven! For some culinary inspiration check out the GoSun Recipe Blog.

Can the GoSun Sport boil water?

GoSun does no recommend boiling water in the Sport directly against he tube. We are however currently in the final stages of manufacturing the GoSun Brew, our water boiling insert, fit for the GoSun Sport. To be kept in the loop about the GoSun, join our mailing list at the bottom of this page.

How much Sun do I need to cook?

You might be surprised how little Sun is needed to finish a meal in a solar powered oven. As a rule of thumb, the stove will cook quickly if you can see a defined shadow from your hand even when overcast, windy and in some cases rainy. If thick clouds are spotty, cooking is still possible, though it will take longer as the stove builds up heat during the sunny periods. We suggest using a weather tracking app like My Radar to help plan and set you up for success!

 How do I know when my food is done?

Many foods will finish cooking when the internal temperature of the food hits near 212°F/100°C in the GoSun oven. This means that steam is a strong indicator of a dish's progress. Noticing smell is another easy and surprisingly intuitive way to judging your food's progress, just make sure not to burn your nose! Give it a couple tries and you'll be a pro.
settings.prospec-cnt:
Dry Weight: 7 lbs (3.18kg)

Oven Volume: 40oz (1.2L) fluid or up to 3 lbs (1.4kg) of food

Oven Dimensions: 2.7” (7.0cm) outside diameter, 2.1” (5.4cm) inside diameter , 24” (61cm) length

Unit Open Size: 24” (61cm) long x 16” (41cm) tall x 12” (30cm) wide

Unit Closed Size: 24” (61cm) long x 8” (20cm) tall x 5” (13cm) wide

Estimated Power Output: 200 Watts in full sunlight

Maximum Temperature: 550°F (288°C)

Working Temperature: 200°F (93°C) – 450°F (232°C)

User's Manual: Always a good thing to have

settings.content: (Purchase the clamp accessory here )

GoSun has been awarded CTA's Small Business of the Year award for 2017. We are proud to receive this honor and would like to continue to focus on making a difference and to do our part to provide zero fuel solutions for cooking worldwide. 

GoSun also participated in the tech.co, 2017 Start-Up of the Year competition. Out of over 1,000 applications, 100 were selected to pitch at Innovate/Celebrate and of those, GoSun was selected as one of the Top 5 Finalists to then pitch on the main stage in front of the entire audience.

CTA's Innovation Entrepreneur Awards program recognizes executives and leading businesses with revenues under $30 million and the contributions they make to the U.S. economy. These individuals and small businesses in the consumer technology industry demonstrate innovation, dedication to the industry, community outreach and the tenacity to persevere through business and economic challenges.

settings.title: BUY A STOVE AND RECEIVE TWO FREE GIFTS
settings.text: CHOOSE FROM: PORTABLE CHARGERS, SILICONE BAKING CUPS OR EXTRA GRILL PANS

settings.content:
GoSun is a young company comprised of designers, engineers, and change-makers, intent on serving the world with unparalleled green cooking solutions. We are passionate about our products and how they power our customers’ lives. Founded in a small suburban garage, we grew quickly thanks to our community of committed customers, who not only believe in our products, but also use them to bring people together. 

At GoSun, we are big believers in nourishing the good things in life and helping others do the same.

After a long morning disassembling a solar water heating device, GoSun founder and solar energy expert, Patrick Sherwin, realized that the vacuum tubes sitting next to him might be able to reheat his lunch. When the food came out hot and roasted, it was an epiphany. Having lived extensively off the grid and working on solar energy projects around the world, he knew that he was on to something.

While volunteering with non-profits in Haiti and Latin America, Patrick experienced first-hand the vulnerability of energy poverty. Touched by the resilience and happiness of those living on just $2.00/day, he spent years facilitating technology, energy and social innovations in the developing world. These efforts, including many failures to introduce typical solar ovens, led to the realization that his solar hot dog cooker invention could be something more, serving a great need in emerging markets.

For the full story, listen to this interview with Patrick on the Inside the Adventure podcast. To see his latest adventure living off only solar cooked food for 40 days take a look at the 40 Days Of Sunshine Blog.

Many organizations are striving to create fewer emissions or less pollution in their products.  Many are striving to do better.  GoSun believes that there are way too many things in the world these days that really don’t contribute to society or help alleviate the major environmental problems that are threatening the world that we all live in.

So why a solar cooker?

1) It can help people cook without any fossil fuels, charcoal, or wood.

According to the United Nations, one of the largest problems facing the world today is clean cooking. Every day 3 Billion people (40% of the Earth’s population) are still cooking on open fires that consume forests and waste money.

2) Solar cooking produces NO harmful smoke or emissions.

The World Health Organization estimates that 4 million people die prematurely as a result of illness attributable to household air pollution from cooking with solid fuels.

3) GoSun helps prevent CO2 and global warming.

In Paul Hawken’s latest book “Drawdown”, he outlines how getting people off of open cookstoves in developing countries is one of the best things we can do to help slow down global warming. Indeed, solar cookers if used daily can save two metric tons of carbon dioxide (CO2) emissions per year per household!

4) Designed to Work. 

Using the best solar cooking design amplifies all the above benefits, which is why the GoSun line of products incorporates clever design to provide the most versatile and useful solar ovens.

PLANT MORE TREES

Data also shows that one of the best things we can to help the planet  and to help combat climate change is to plant more trees.  Why?  According to CarbonFootprint.com, a tree can offset 48 pounds of CO2 per year, or 2,000 pounds (one ton) of CO2 during a tree’s life. To these efforts with our partnership with Trees For the Future, GoSun has helped plant over 20,000 trees to date.

Good Global Citizen. 

Although GoSun is still a small entrepreneurial business, we believe we should all do what we can, when we can.  Since our inception, we have worked with dozens of nonprofit organizations to provide discounted solar cookers to those that need them most.  In 2017, GoSun has provided funding to support the efforts of The Houston Food Bank, Global Giving, and Operation BBQ Relief, in 2018 we made donations to The American Red Cross and World Central Kitchen to assist in Hurricane Florence relief efforts. And we made a donation to the California Community Wildfire Relief Fund to aid in the the camp fire relief efforts. We are committed to doing more and welcome your input about how we can accomplish this. Please get in touch with us and let us know your ideas and projects.

GoSun - Use More Sun!

In 2014, we received a grant from the Global Alliance for Clean Cookstoves for our pilot program in Guatemala.  Although we have now shipped our products to over 60 countries, we are seeking partners throughout the world to locally assemble and distribute our breakthrough solar technologies all over the world.

GoSun's patented technology allows anyone to bake or cook anything, using just the sun even in the clouds and freezing cold. GoSun  is driven to provide more consumer friendly solar solutions to the people who need them most.

settings.title: BEHIND THE REVOLUTION
settings.content: MEET THE TEAM

settings.product_detail_image_1_cnt:
FOUNDER AND CEO

Driven by passion and purpose, Patrick brings to the table decades of experience in solar energy, electric vehicles and youth wilderness education. His favorite GoSun recipe is a medley of seasonal root veggies with a light seasoning.
settings.product_detail_image_2_cnt:
SOCIAL IMPACT DESIGNER

An industrial designer by training, Matt manages GoSun’s media presence as well as developing business opportunities in emerging markets. Matt’s favorite recipe is simple Asparagus fried on the GoSun Sport with salt, olive oil and a sprinkle of el ras hanout.
settings.product_detail_image_3_cnt:
SALES MANAGER

Proclaimed by the team as the company “mid-fielder” Peter holds our operations together with an impeccable attention to detail. His favorite GoSun recipe is hearty chicken parmesan on the GoSun Grill.

settings.product_detail_image_1_cnt:
PRODUCT MANAGER

GoSun’s silent MVP, Thomas manages product fulfillment, shipping and more, cycling to and from work every day. His favorite recipe is curried sweet potatoes fries with a simple aioli prepared in the GoSun Sport.
settings.product_detail_image_2_cnt:
OFFICE MANAGER

A master of the office, Nikki brings more than a decade of customer service and office experience to the GoSun team, as well as a creative hand in the kitchen pushing our recipes to the next level.
settings.product_detail_image_3_cnt:
OUTSIDE SALES EXECTUIVE

Perhaps GoSun's most animated character, Davey is not only a skilled salesman but a force of nature in the kitchen. His favorite GoSun dish is lamb meatballs with freshly ground spices baked in the Sport with a mint-cilantro cream sauce. His curried Welsh pasties are a close second.

settings.product_detail_image_1_cnt:
INDUSTRIAL DESIGNER

A master designer, Nate can singlehandedly take most any design from concept and ideation to manufacturing reality. With multiple award winning designs under his belt, Nate is a professional explorer of what’s possible. His favorite recipe is most anything that’s fresh in the garden with salt and oil.
settings.product_detail_image_2_cnt:
DESIGN INTERN

A student from Loughborough University, one of the UK’s top ranked industrial design programs, Edison has been exploring the cutting edge of fuel-free cooking throughout his year long internship. His favorite GoSun dish is farmer’s market sausage and local eggs with hot sauce in the GoSun Sport.
settings.product_detail_image_3_cnt:
ACCOUNTING AND FINANCES

With more nearly 20 years of professional accounting experience, Nick keeps the GoSun ship pointed straight and the tax man happy. Nick’s favorite recipe is vegetable korma in the GoSun Grill with a healthy serving of coffee on the side.

settings.product_detail_image_1_cnt: Just open and relax. No empty tanks to replace or burnt carbon crud to scrape.
settings.product_detail_image_2_cnt: No fire hazard here. Just load your food and let the Sun do the cooking!
settings.product_detail_image_3_cnt: Simple to use, cool to touch and large enough to feed eight, the Grill was designed with the family in mind.

settings.faq-cnt:
How much Sun do I need to cook?

Bake, roast, steam and fry, the GoSun Sport is a versatile cooker! For some culinary inspiration check out the GoSun Recipe Blog.

How much Sun do I need to cook?

The Grill is designed to be preheated before use. Even overcast skies can build into a heated chamber ready to cook. Once heated, medium and large dishes will require at least partial Sun to continue cooking.

How do I know when my food is done?

Many foods will finish cooking when the internal temperature of the food hits near 212°F/100°C. This means that steam is a strong indicator of a dish's progress. Noticing smell is another easy and surprisingly intuitive way to judging your food's progress. Give it a couple tries and you'll be a pro.

Is there a warranty?

The GoSun Grill comes with a Two-Year, "No-Questions-Asked" Warranty on the vacuum cooking chamber. This cooking tube is made of borosilicate glass, and is extremely durable, much like other common forms of Pyrex ® cookware. If you have any troubles, we will send you a replacement tube FREE of charge to anywhere in the world... we just ask that you pay the associated shipping costs.

settings.title: GoSun GO<sup>™</sup>
settings.text: The GoSun Go™ is our most portable and most affordable solar oven yet. Fast, reliable and fuel-free weighing in at 2 lbs (0.9 kg), endless fuel included. Use More Sun.

settings.title: GoSun Chill
settings.text: The Chill is more than a cooler, it's an off-grid refrigerator without the noisy generator. GoSun joins the latest high-efficiency compressor technology with a solar-powered eco-system to keep you fueled and cooled no matter what.

settings.title: GOSUN GRILL<sup>®</sup>
settings.text: Bake, boil or fry a meal for eight people, (4x more food than the GoSun Sport) using only the sun. A complete redesign of the modern grill, this solar grill is the ultimate solar cooker, making it the perfect compliment to your outdoor cooking kitchen.

settings.title: GOSUN SPORT<sup>®</sup>
settings.text: The Sport™ sets the bar for portable solar ovens. Bake, roast or steam a meal for two people in minutes reaching up to 550°F (290°C). GoSun Sport sets the bar for portable solar stoves.

settings.faq-cnt:
What can the GoSun Sport cook?

Bake, roast, steam and fry, the GoSun Sport is a versatile cooker! For some culinary inspiration check out the GoSun Recipe Blog.

How much Sun do I need to cook?

You might be surprised how little Sun is needed to finish a meal. As a rule of thumb, the stove will cook quickly if you can see a defined shadow from your hand even when overcast, windy and in some cases rainy. If thick clouds are spotty, cooking is still possible, though it will take longer as the stove builds up heat during the sunny periods. We suggest using a weather tracking app like My Radar to help plan and set you up for success!

 How do I know when my food is done?

Many foods will finish cooking when the internal temperature of the food hits near 212°F/100°C. This means that steam is a strong indicator of a dish's progress. Noticing smell is another easy and surprisingly intuitive way to judging your food's progress, just make sure not to burn your nose! Give it a couple tries and you'll be a pro.

settings.title: Get the full package
settings.text: Everything you need to cook like a Pro with your GoSun Sport.

settings.title: HOW IT WORKS
settings.text: Sunlight is focused by the compound parabolic reflectors onto the tube, heating the inner cooking chamber. The vacuum tube acts as a near-perfect insulator, converting more than 80% of the Sun's rays into useable heat. The heat inside mimics that of an oven, building up to a staggering 550°F/ 280°C!

settings.faq-cnt:
What can the GoSun Sport cook?

Bake, roast, steam and fry, the GoSun Sport is a versatile solar oven! For some culinary inspiration check out the GoSun Recipe Blog.

Can the GoSun Sport boil water?

GoSun does not recommend boiling water in the Sport directly against the tube. We are however currently in the final stages of manufacturing the GoSun Brew, our water boiling insert for the GoSun Sport. To be kept in the loop about GoSun, join our mailing list at the bottom of this page.

How much Sun do I need to cook?

You might be surprised how little Sun is needed to finish a meal in a solar powered oven. As a rule of thumb, the stove will cook quickly if you can see a defined shadow from your hand even when overcast, windy and in some cases rainy. If thick clouds are spotty, cooking is still possible, though it will take longer as the stove builds up heat during the sunny periods. We suggest using a weather tracking app like My Radar to help plan and set you up for success!

 How do I know when my food is done?

Many foods will finish cooking when the internal temperature of the food hits near 212°F/100°C in the GoSun oven. This means that steam is a strong indicator of a dish's progress. Noticing smell is another easy and surprisingly intuitive way to judging your food's progress, just make sure not to burn your nose! Give it a couple tries and you'll be a pro.

The GoSun trademarks are registered in the U.S. and other countries. Use of the GoSun trademarks for commercial purposes without the prior written consent of GoSun Inc. may constitute trademark infringement and unfair competition in violation of federal and state laws.

Authorized Use of GoSun Trademarks
Advertising, Promotional, and Sales Materials: Only GoSun and its authorized resellers and licensees may use the GoSun Logo and other GoSun trademarks in advertising, promotional, and sales materials. Such authorized parties may use the GoSun Logo and other GoSun trademarks only as specified in their agreement with GoSun and any associated Guidelines and such use must always be in conjunction with the appropriate terms that define the relationship authorized by their contract with GoSun.

Copyright
A copyright is a property right in an original work of authorship. Copyright is recognized in most countries of the world by statutory copyright laws. All of GoSun’s photos, videos, images and descriptive material are protected by copyright.

Patents
GoSun’s products are protected by patents in the U.S. and elsewhere.

settings.title: SPACE AGE TECHNOLOGY
settings.text: GoSun's patented solar cooking technology makes cooking with the Sun more practical than ever. Find out why thousands are switching to solar.

settings.title: A SOLAR COOKING CHALLENGE
settings.content:
To commemorate his 40th trip around the Sun, GoSun’s founder, Patrick Sherwin, will be traveling the USA, eating only solar cooked food for 40 days.  Starting February 16th and ending March 27th, this record-breaking trip will revolve around GoSun’s users, technology and adventure.  Join Patrick, rain or shine, through daily video blogs as he documents the people, places and meals that make up the fuel-free frontier.

Kicking off the social experiment, Sherwin asks, “Is it possible to thrive on solar cooked meals during a Midwest winter?  What if the Sun doesn’t shine for days?  Will there be side effects, good or bad, to all that solar cooking?”

As Inventor and Social Entrepreneur, Patrick, is not afraid of taking a chance, trying something never done before and adapting to the hardline realities.  For 40 days, his diet will subsist of foods that have only been solar cooked; so no raw fruit or veggies, no salad, no snacks and no nourishing drinks.

During the adventure, Patrick will meet with friends, family and experts to explore more about powering the good life with solar energy.  Experiences will range from foraging for food, to envisioning the future and from backpacking in the Smokies, to sailing the Caribbean.  One thing is sure, GoSun’s technology will be put to the test as it keeps up with Patrick’s appetite for experiences, food and freedom. 

In addition to pushing his own limits, Patrick will be field testing several of GoSun’s latest products to be sure they can keep up with real life demands.  He will be carrying the all new, GoSun Go, which becomes available this spring, and using it to boil water and prepare meals on the go.

settings.title: FOLLOW THE JOURNEY HERE
settings.text: GoSun’s inventor, Patrick Sherwin, embarks on a wintertime adventure to prove GoSun is reliable, rugged and ready to power the good life.

settings.contact_content: Have something to say about this journey? Please feel free to reach out and let us know what is on your mind about this 40 Day journey and we will get back to you as soon as we can.

settings.title: Self Reliance and Personal Responsibility
settings.content: In truth, according to the American Red Cross, less than seven percent of Americans are prepared for a disaster. You don't have to be one of them. It is important to create a solution for being prepared and having a GoSun is a perfect part of this solution.

Kicking off the social experiment, Sherwin asks, “Is it possible to thrive on solar cooked meals during a Midwest winter?  What if the Sun doesn’t shine for days?  Will there be side effects, good or bad, to all that solar cooking?”

As Inventor and Social Entrepreneur, Patrick, is not afraid of taking a chance, trying something never done before and adapting to the hardline realities.  For 40 days, his diet will subsist of foods that have only been solar cooked; so no raw fruit or veggies, no salad, no snacks and no nourishing drinks.

During the adventure, Patrick will meet with friends, family and experts to explore more about powering the good life with solar energy.  Experiences will range from foraging for food, to envisioning the future and from backpacking in the Smokies, to sailing the Caribbean.  One thing is sure, GoSun’s technology will be put to the test as it keeps up with Patrick’s appetite for experiences, food and freedom. 

In addition to pushing his own limits, Patrick will be field testing several of GoSun’s latest products to be sure they can keep up with real life demands.  He will be carrying the all new, GoSun Go, which becomes available this spring, and using it to boil water and prepare meals on the go.

settings.title: WHY OUR CUSTOMERS LOVE Our Solar Cookers
settings.content: Our solar ovens use patented technology to enable people to use solar cooking for all their outdoor cooking needs

settings.title: THE KIT INCLUDES
settings.content:
Extended Arm Latches: Increase you reflectors’ wingspan (and total solar power) by swapping the stock Arm Latches with newer, longer latches.  

Heat Bank Removal Kit: Reduce your thermal load by removing the Grill’s aluminum Heat Bank Insert.  Once removed, you’re no longer pre-heating the Heat Bank first, allowing for faster cooking times and higher temperatures.   Simply remove the block and replace it with a small metal brace and tray clip to hold your tray.

Updated Specs: With this new combo, you are welcome to Pre-Heat the GoSun Grill to #6 on the Temperature Gauge (instead of the previous #3).  This allows greater heat momentum to build so meals can be prepared in much less time.  

The package includes several parts and requires about ten minutes, a Phillips head screwdriver, and a pair of needle nose pliers to install. For more info on the steps required to install, take a look at this manual.
